channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Icebreakers With...Andrew Ross Sorkin
item.description: I work 80+ hours a week and I've always done it because I love it.  What is the dumbest thing you made your parents buy for you as a kid? I convinced my father, based on my track record of making money trading cards, to invest in a case of Fleer Ultra baseball cards. It isn't that he is intimidating as a person; it is that he is so smart and deep on so many different topics. So I'm going to try to figure out how to do a lot more of my work with my family within reach and to be more strategic about travel, work dinners, etc.  You can only do one: writing for the New York Times, TV anchoring, or producing (co-creating Billions for Showtime, developing a GameStop film for HBO). We still have the cards if anyone wants to buy them.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Hot Rod Charlie and His Five Best Human Friends Have Big Kentucky Derby Dreams
item.description: So, as the friends traveled the country over the last year to watch Chuck run and also perhaps enjoy a few beers, they never expected the horse to end up qualifying for the most elite horse race in the world. After their first two horses didn’t work out, they found Hot Rod Charlie, the horse that currently has the fourth-best odds to win the Kentucky Derby this Saturday. Baby Chuck via Patrick O'Neill The people’s horseO’Neill said that the Boat Racing crew has received a lot of support from family and friends, but also from people they’ve never met. In every good horse movie—Seabiscuit, Hidalgo, Racing Stripes—there’s a brooding protagonist who, throughout everything, believes their horse can win. He’d seen the way betting on horse racing had driven wedges between families and friends in the past, even his own family at times. To even be considered for the big day, the horse has to be three years old, which means every horse running this year’s race was one of the 19,664 registered Thoroughbreds born in 2018. Patrick O’Neill grew up watching horse races and has always loved the sport. The crew, most of whom went into finance after graduating, approached wiggling into the high-dollar sport sort of like a hedge fund, pooling their money to own 25% of Chuck (O’Neill said we could call the horse by his nickname because we’re cool).
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Top NFL Draft Pick, Trevor Lawrence, Puts Signing Bonus in Crypto
item.description: Big picture: Lawrence joins a couple other NFL players who are dabbling in bitcoin. Lawrence has partnered with Blockfolio, a crypto investment app, to invest his estimated $22,630,055 signing bonus in bitcoin, ether, and yes, dogecoin. Looking ahead...
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: April 30
item.description: Quote: "We are looking at it but in a lot of cases gig workers should be classified as employees... (The Drift) Read: Nomadland, my mother, and the frontier’s broken promise.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: FDA Ensures Menthol Ban Wouldn’t Target Individuals
item.description: Black health experts have been working to get menthol-flavored tobacco products banned for over a decade, citing tobacco companies’ aggressive marketing campaigns targeted at Black smokers.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Stock Market Surges Under Biden
item.description: After Biden, it’s…JFK (1961): 9.27% gain for the S&P in 100 daysGeorge H.W. Bush (1989): 7.93%Donald Trump (2017): 5.32%Average since 1929: 3.8%Zoom out: The occupant of the White House is just one factor among many that determines stock market performance, and the economic recovery from Covid-19 was well underway before Biden was elected.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The US Economy Is Almost Back to Full Strength
item.description: Heck, even cruises could restart by mid-July, the CDC said yesterday. Zoom out: While the situation in the US is highly encouraging, in India it’s only getting worse.  Now, the US economy is less than 1% off its pre-Covid peak. Full reopenings are coming. Yesterday, NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio said the city will “fully reopen” for business July 1, just 14 months after the city was paralyzed by an initial Covid-19 wave. Halfway through earnings season, S&P 500 companies have reported the strongest earnings growth in more than a decade. Covid cases are falling.
item.author: Neal Freyman

Yesterday, NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio said the city will “fully reopen” for business July 1, just 14 months after the city was paralyzed by an initial Covid-19 wave. item.title: Tractor Supply Credits Strong Q1 Earnings to Millennials Moving to Suburban and Rural Areas
item.description: Tractor Supply, the rural US retailer famous for carrying everything except tractors, said that half of the 11 million chickens it sold in 2020 were to new customers. as big cities that emptied out at the start of the pandemic open back up, Tractor Supply isn’t worried about young people ditching the simple life.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: April 29
item.description: That’s more annual ad revenue than Snap or Pinterest. He said young people should “absolutely” get vaccinated. (The Guardian)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Samsung Heirs Agree to Pay The Biggest Inheritance Tax Ever
item.description: The Samsung heirs said they’ll pay approximately one Cave of Wonders in inheritance tax following the death of Samsung chairman and family head Lee Kun-hee last year. And the family scandals didn’t stop there: Lee Kun-hee’s son Lee Jae-yong (above) served one year behind bars for bribery. ever.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Ethereum Hits Record High
item.description: Ethereum is the blockchain network that conducts transactions using ether, the name of its cryptocurrency. Run exchanges, take out loans, send ether to family and friends, and more. Right now, one bitcoin = more than 20 ether.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Biden Lays Out American Families Plan in Primetime Address
item.description: Big picture: Taken with the president’s two other spending proposals, the American Families Plan represents his administration’s view that the federal government can and should play a significant role in shaping the US economy. Biden’s plan includes a) bumping up the top income tax rate from 37% to 39.6% b) nearly doubling the capital gains tax for wealthy investors, and c) giving more resources to the IRS to crack down on tax avoiders. Here’s a quick review of the other two bills: The American Rescue Plan: This was the $1.9 trillion Covid-19 relief bill Congress passed in March.
item.author: Neal Freyman

Biden’s plan includes a) bumping up the top income tax rate from 37% to 39.6% b) nearly doubling the capital gains tax for wealthy investors, and c) giving more resources to the IRS to crack down on tax avoiders.

item.title: Reader Q&A: Getting Real About Real Estate
item.description: Q: "Will the housing market crash like it did in 2008?" But do expect an affordability crisis if we don’t build more homes.  In conclusion, don’t expect a Big Short 2. The typical credit score for mortgage borrowers in the second half of last year was 786, a record high.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Teen Banking Apps Secure More Funding
item.description: How are Current and Step different? Yesterday, two such apps, Current and Step, announced new funding rounds of $220 million and $100 million, respectively. Step has 1.5 million, but has only been around for six months.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: April 28
item.description: (Not Boring) Read: Who disrupts the disruptors?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Companies Post Strong Quarters With Pandemic Waning in the US
item.description: Starbucks: US same-store sales have returned to pre-pandemic levels. While traffic is down by 10%, the average order has increased 21% (it's hard to resist that nitro cold brew). The tech company recorded its biggest quarterly jump in PC shipments in more than 20 years.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The CDC Updates Its Mask-Wearing Guidelines
item.description: The agency said that fully vaccinated folks can do the following activities sans masks:Dine outside with non-roommatesGo on walks, hikes, or bike rides alone or with household membersAttend small, outdoor events, even if some attendees haven't been vaccinated yetWhy now?
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Apple, Spotify Unveil New Podcast Subscription Products
item.description: The Swedish streamer now has 2.2+ million podcasts and is expected to pass Apple in US pod listeners this year. Apple's plan: For $19.99/year, podcasters can access features to turn their shows into subscription offerings. NPR just revealed paid subscriptions for ad-free podcasts, accessible through both Apple and Spotify. Spotify's plan: a new ad marketplace that makes it easier for podcasters to find advertisers and the ability to distribute premium podcasts on other platforms.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The CDC Updates Its Mask-Wearing Guidelines
item.description: The agency said that fully vaccinated folks can do the following activities sans masks:Dine outside with non-roommatesGo on walks, hikes, or bike rides alone or with household membersAttend small, outdoor events, even if some attendees haven't been vaccinated yetWhy now?
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Apple, Spotify Unveil New Podcast Subscription Products
item.description: The Swedish streamer now has 2.2+ million podcasts and is expected to pass Apple in US pod listeners this year. Apple's plan: For $19.99/year, podcasters can access features to turn their shows into subscription offerings. NPR just revealed paid subscriptions for ad-free podcasts, accessible through both Apple and Spotify. Apple takes a 30% cut of revenues the first year and 15% the following years. Spotify's plan: a new ad marketplace that makes it easier for podcasters to find advertisers and allows for the distribution of premium podcasts on other platforms.  So will you pay?
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: April 28
item.description: (Not Boring) Read: Who disrupts the disruptors?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Business Acronyms You Should Know: The Master Guide
item.description: DOJ: The Department of Justice enforces US laws and handles federal civil and criminal cases. In business-to-business (B2B), the product is for a corporate customer.  SEC: The Securities and Exchange Commission is a federal agency that regulates securities markets (securities = financial instruments like stocks and bonds) to protect investors. US agencies and regulatorsCDC: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention; if you don't know this after a year of Covid…it is responsible for promoting public health at home and abroad, responding to infectious diseases, and researching threats to human health.   FTC: The Federal Trade Commission is responsible for enforcing consumer protection laws and civil antitrust law. ) The finance-y stuffIPO: An initial public offering is a way for companies to go from private → public and raise capital by selling shares to public investors on a stock exchange.  WHO: The World Health Organization is a UN agency focused on public health—monitoring risks, responding to emergencies, promoting universal healthcare, and setting international standards.  OECD: The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development is an economic organization of 37 so-called "developed" nations. S&P: Standard & Poor's (now known as S&P Global) is an analytics and financial data corporation. 19 members are part of the common currency "eurozone,." In direct-to-consumer, companies like Warby Parker send their product straight to you. But, often, the business world can feel like a jumble of insider language and acronyms. ESG: Environmental, social, and governance is a framework that measures corporations' positions on issues like human rights, diversity, employee welfare, and climate impacts. It's one of the most widely used indicators of economic health. It's goal is to coordinate prices and keep oil markets stable. UI: User experience vs. It's goal is to promote economic development and global trade. CSR: Corporate social responsibility offers a model for businesses to have a positive impact on society and remain accountable not only to shareholders, but also to the public.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Companies Post Strong Quarters With Pandemic Waning in the US
item.description: Starbucks: US same-store sales have returned to pre-pandemic levels. While traffic is down by 10%, the average order has increased 21% (it's hard to resist that nitro cold brew). The tech company recorded its biggest quarterly jump in PC shipments in more than 20 years.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Reader Q&A: Getting Real About Real Estate
item.description: Yes, prices are rising at an astonishing pace, but there are good reasons for that: housing inventory hit a record low this year, demand is so furious builders can’t keep up, and low mortgage rates are attracting new buyers into the marketplace. Q: Will the housing market crash like it did in 2008?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: April 27
item.description: (NYT) Read: How Mark Zuckerberg and Tim Cook became foes. CEO Jonathan Karp has already pushed back against employee objections to publishing a book by former VP Mike Pence, saying, "We come to work each day to publish, not cancel."
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: MindMed Becomes the US’ Second Public Psychedelics Company
item.description: “Therapists are going to be a key component of making this whole new approach work,” Rahn said.  Bottom line: Don’t expect to cure your anxiety by taking MindMed’s meds in the woods with friends. In November, Oregon became the first state to legalize the medical use of psilocybin, and other jurisdictions are moving in that direction.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: OnlyFans Grows Revenue 553% During Pandemic
item.description: The London-based platform offers sex workers, fitness influencers, and celebrities like rapper Cardi B an avenue to connect directly with fans and get paid via subscription services plus tips. Its user base grew from less than 20 million to more than 120 million.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: US to Send 60M AstraZeneca Vaccines to Foreign Countries
item.description: Now that it has millions of shots to spare, the US is getting back to being a geopolitical busybody, which includes countering China's and Russia's growing influence in lower-income countries from their own vaccine diplomacy efforts.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Telsa Posts Record Quarterly Profit
item.description: The incident was plastered across Chinese social media, embarrassing Tesla in this crucial market for EVs. Crashes: Tesla is facing more than two dozen investigations from federal safety officials into whether its advanced driver-assist system, Autopilot, played a role in recent crashes.   But if there's one thing we know about Tesla... Last week, a woman jumped on the roof of a Tesla at the Shanghai Auto Show to protest the company's handling of a crash that injured her parents. Tesla posted a record profit of $438 million and grew revenue 74% annually last quarter.
item.author: Neal Freyman
